trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Create a new app by reserving a unique name** and click **Continue**, then type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create a new app by reserving a unique name** and click **Continue**, then type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: In solution explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.
trans-unit.target: In solution explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account, select the app that you registered in step 2, click **Next**, and then click **Associate**.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account, select the app that you registered in step 2, click **Next**, and then click **Associate**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) For a universal Windows app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) For a universal Windows app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services**.

trans-unit.source: In the Services page, click **Live Services site** under **Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the Services page, click **Live Services site** under **Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: Click **API Settings**, select enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, supply the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, supply a value of `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/login/microsoftaccount/` in **Redirect URL**, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **API Settings**, select enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, supply the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, supply a value of `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/login/microsoftaccount/` in **Redirect URL**, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In **App settings**, make a note of the values of **Client ID**, **Client secret**, and **Package security identifier (SID)**.
trans-unit.target: In **App settings**, make a note of the values of **Client ID**, **Client secret**, and **Package security identifier (SID)**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do not share these secrets with anyone or distribute them with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share these secrets with anyone or distribute them with your app.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Identity** tab, enter the **Client Secret** and **Package SID** values obtained from WNS in Step 4, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Identity** tab, enter the **Client Secret** and **Package SID** values obtained from WNS in Step 4, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Identity** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Identity** tab.

trans-unit.source: Notice the **Client Secret** and **Package SID** values are already set from the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Notice the **Client Secret** and **Package SID** values are already set from the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **Client ID** you previously made note of, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **Client ID** you previously made note of, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use a Microsoft account for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use a Microsoft account for authentication in your app.
